awd_titl_txt: Training In and Application of State-of-the-Art             Spectrometric and Liquid Chromatographic Techniques in      Undergraduate Marine Science Curricula
awd_abstract_narration: Marine programs at the Shannon Point Marine Center will be                      enhanced by the purchase of a High Performance Liquid                           Chromatography system.  This modern marine research equipment                   will be used by Western Washington students majoring in                         environmental science and biology (in Marine Ecology and in                     Estuary courses), by community college students, and students                   doing independent research projects.  Workshops will train the                  community college faculty and students, and the WWU students in                 the use of this equipment, which will enable them to analyze                    water samples for petroleum hydrocarbons, PAH's, fatty acids, and               selected nutrients (nitrates and phosphates).  The university                   will provide 50% matching funds.
